Description: Heavy axe-head: it has been completely cleaned of corrosion product and is in good condition. The only damaged area is the cutting edge, which has been cracked, chipped and turned through use but is still quite sharp in parts. The sides of the axe are slightly bevelled and bear the marks of a grinding tool. Chased in the surface of one face are two hieroglyphs.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (19)
